children.subject: I have the exact same question. I would appreciate if someone could clarify

history.content:
The emergency drop applies only to the Fall and Spring semesters so that isn't an option.

The drop deadline for summer sessions C with refund is today, June 24, and with no refund is June 29.

I don't think you'd be able to drop classes after this. The only way out would be to change your grading option, the deadline for which is July 27.

Source: http://summer.berkeley.edu/registration/schedule

The emergency drop applies only to the Fall and Spring semesters so that isn't an option.

The drop deadline for summer sessions C with refund is today, June 24, and with no refund is June 29.

I don't think you'd be able to drop classes after this. The only option would be to change your grading option, the deadline for which is July 27.

Source: http://summer.berkeley.edu/registration/schedule

Note that the emergency drop policy only applies to students in the College of L&S.

The form is here https://ls.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/latechangeclassschedule_sp18.pdf   and does specify fall or spring although it may be an oversight and they may be willing to count summer but you would need to set up an appointment with your college advisor (assuming you are in L&S).  Of course, that can't happen in between when you asked the question here (Saturday) and the deadline for you making a decision without that knowledge (today/Sunday).

Hello,
I am currently enrolled in CS 70 and am worried that the pace that the class currently moves in may prove to be a bit too fast for my personal taste, especially from here on out. Is it possible to drop the class at any point beyond the drop deadline (which is tomorrow), withdrawing me from Summer Sessions, and still be able to take it in the Fall or Spring? I'm aware that there is emergency drop available in the Fall and Spring semesters, but I am unsure on whether or not this policy applies in the summer. If I could get a clarification on what exactly is the case, especially by the end of the day/tomorrow, that would be incredibly helpful. Any suggestions on CS 70 in the summer would be much appreciated. Thanks!
history.subject: Summer CS 70 Late Drop
